text: is a Japanese football player. She plays for Nippon TV Beleza and Japan national team. ==Club career== Ueki was born in Kanagawa Prefecture on 30 July 1999. She joined L.League club Nippon TV Beleza from youth team in 2016. She became a regular player as forward from 2017 season. ==National team career== In 2016, Ueki was selected Japan U-17 national team for 2016 U-17 World Cup.FIFA She played at 5 matches and scored 4 goals, and Japan won the 2nd place. In 2018, Ueki was selected Japan U-20 national team for 2018 U-20 World Cup.FIFA She played at all 6 matches and scored 5 goals, and Japan won the championship. On 4 April 2019, Ueki debuted for Japan national team against France.Japan Football Association Later that year, Ueki was named to Japan's squad for the 2019 FIFA Women's World Cup; however, she was forced to withdraw due to injury on 31 May. ==National team statistics== List of match in 2019 at Japan Football Association {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" ! colspan=3 | Japan national team |- !Year!!Apps!!Goals |- |2019||3||0 |- !Total||3||0 |} ==References== ==External links== * * * *Japan Football Association Category:1999 births Category:Living people Category:Association football people from Kanagawa Prefecture Category:Japanese women's footballers Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Nippon TV Beleza players Category:Women's association football forwards
title: Riko Ueki
